intro: Coussapoa argentea, commonly known as silverleaf balsa, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking silvery-white underside on its leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its soft, lightweight wood. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its unique foliage and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
